channel.title: [317](Devolution) Problems with run
channel.description:
This isn't portforwarding, Ik how to do that, just that I myself can't connect to it. It has the local IP set. It isn't portforwarded yet, which I don't want it to. But in the server part of files, I try to click run, and it says this.
[code]Error occurred during initialization of VM Could not reserve enough space for object heap Could not create Java virtual machine. Press any key to continue...[/code]
It compiles fine, I have my paths set with JDK Version 6 Update 22. Latest version. And it goes fine on my friends computer. I have Windows XP. If you need any more info on how to fix it, then ask. :s I don't know what's wrong.
Here is what's in my Run file that I'm having trouble with.
[code]@echo off title Server java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause [/code]

item.title: [317](Devolution) Problems with run
item.dc:creator: @Sweet_Ride Sweet Ride
item.description:
@Sweet_Ride wrote:

This isn’t portforwarding, Ik how to do that, just that I myself can’t connect to it. It has the local IP set. It isn’t portforwarded yet, which I don’t want it to. But in the server part of files, I try to click run, and it says this.

Error occurred during initialization of VM Could not reserve enough space for object heap Could not create Java virtual machine. Press any key to continue...

It compiles fine, I have my paths set with JDK Version 6 Update 22. Latest version. And it goes fine on my friends computer. I have Windows XP. If you need any more info on how to fix it, then ask. :s I don’t know what’s wrong.

Here is what’s in my Run file that I’m having trouble with.

@echo off title Server java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause
